page.title: 09LOWER REDBROOK: CHANGES
page.content: In{1945}the{Redbrook Tinplate Co., {renowned for producing}the thinnest tinplate in the world, flourished. Most village men and a few women worked there. On its site is the{ {Redbrook Construction Ltd. Company} which employs few village men. Most men and women have to go outside the village to work. There were two public houses in {Lower Redbrook},{The King's Head}and {The Bell Inn.}The former was replaced by the{Startime Garage.}There was no Sunday opening then. Then there was a fortnightly{dance}and {billiards}in the hall and the wireless or card games at home.Now{bingo}and{ {whist drives}are held in the hall and{ {television,video recorders}and {computers}provide home entertainment.
